abstract.text: Develop games where multiple players interact in real time.

legalNotices.copyright: Copyright © 2025 Apple Inc. All rights reserved.

inlineContent.text: This sample code project uses the GameKit framework to create a simple real-time game where two players are immediately aware of the actions each other takes.
The sample shows both the matchmaker interface that enables players to invite others, and the automatch feature that lets Game Center find players.
It provides access to Game Center using the access point and dashboard to show the players’ progress toward an achievement, as well as scores on the game leaderboard.
It uses the match object to send game data and text messages between players.
It also uses voice chat for additional communications.
To create your own real-time game, replace the SwiftUI files with your gameplay interface, and modify the
class to support your game. To extend this sample to use matchmaking rules, see
To configure the sample code project, perform the following steps in Xcode:
Choose Xcode > Settings > Accounts, click the Add button (+), and add your Apple ID account.

Select the project in the Project navigator, click the Signing & Capabilities pane, select the target, and assign your team to it. Optionally, enter a unique identifier in the Bundle Identifier text field. Otherwise, use the existing bundle ID that ends in your team ID.
If necessary, add the Game Center capability (see
In App Store Connect, create an app record that matches the bundle ID (see
in App Store Connect Help).
Add a classic leaderboard with
as the leaderboard ID, Integer as the score format type, Best Score as the score submission type, High to Low as the sort order, and
to
as the score range. Add one localization with an integer format. See
Add an achievement with
as the achievement ID,
as the point value, and No for the hidden option (see
). Add one localization with an image.
Connect two iOS devices to your Mac.
If necessary, click Register Device in the Signing & Capabilities pane to create the provisioning profile.
Build and run the sample on the two iOS devices.
If the Welcome to Game Center sheet appears, sign in using a different Apple ID on each device.

content.text: Authenticate the player and register for real-time events

inlineContent.text: Before using any GameKit APIs, the game needs to authenticate the local player by presenting an interface for them to sign in to Game Center on their device.
The
method handles the authentication flow and, when complete, registers for real-time game events.

code: // Register for real-time invitations from other players.

inlineContent.text: To start a real-time game, the player taps Choose Player on the content view.
Then the
method creates a match request for a two-player game and presents a
interface where the player can invite friends or automatch to fill empty slots.

code: // If you use matchmaking rules, set the GKMatchRequest.queueName property here. If the rules use
// game-specific properties, set the local player's GKMatchRequest.properties too.
// Present the interface where the player selects opponents and starts the game.

inlineContent.text: After the player selects an opponent in the Game Center interface, GameKit sends the invitation and changes the view controller interface to show the invitation status.
After the opponent accepts the invitation by tapping the notification that appears, GameKit launches the game on their device and invokes the
protocol method.
This method presents the matchmaker view controller that shows the connection status.

code: // Present the matchmaker view controller in the invitation state.

inlineContent.text: When the status of the players changes from Connecting to Ready in the interface, GameKit invokes the
method in both game instances, passing the local view controller and new
object.
The

The

content.text: Automatch the local player with others

inlineContent.text: To let Game Center find an opponent without presenting the matchmaker view controller, the player taps the Automatch toggle.
The
method creates a match request and passes it to the
method.
When a player running another game instance taps the Automatch toggle, the
method returns a match object.
Then the
method invokes
, which sets the match’s delegate so that when the opponent connects to the match, GameKit calls the
delegate method.
The game view displays a placeholder for the opponent’s name until they connect.
If the state is
when GameKit invokes the
method, it sets the
property and loads the opponent’s avatar, which updates the game view.
To stop finding players, the player taps Automatch again and it invokes
Each time the player takes an action, the game shares the results with the other player.
When the player taps Take Action, their score increases in both game instances.
If the player taps End Game or Forfeit, both game instances exit the match.
The
method increments the score, then encodes and sends the game data to the opponent.
When the player taps the message bubble in the game view, the chat view sheet appears so the player can send a text message to the opponent.
The
method sends the text message as game data.
Similarly, the
and
methods encode and send game data, except they send the game outcome.
In the recipient’s game instance, GameKit invokes the
method.
The
implementation of
decodes the data object and updates the game state, depending on its contents.
For example, this method exits the match if the opponent ends or forfeits the game.
In both game instances, an alert appears showing each player the outcome of the game. When the player taps OK, the game returns to the content view.
When the player taps the telephone bubble in the game view, the
method starts a voice chat audio session with the opponent.
First it creates a
object, providing a unique name for the channel, sets a connection change handler, and sets the volume.

code: // Exit early if the app can't start a voice chat session.
guard let voiceChat = voiceChat else { return }
// Handle an unknown, connected, or disconnected player state.

inlineContent.text: Next it activates a shared audio session.
Then it starts and activates the voice chat.
After both players tap the telephone bubble, the state changes to
and they can begin speaking.
The first time the sample starts voice chat, the system displays a dialog asking the player whether the sample may use the microphone.
This dialog displays the value of the
information property list key as the reason for requesting access permission.
When the player taps the telephone bubble again, the
method stops the voice chat and deactivates the shared audio session.
You can enhance this sample to provide more feedback and controls, such as:
Show when players connect to the voice chat and start speaking in the connection change handler.
Add a control to mute the voice chat using the
and
methods.
Let players change the volume using the
method.
Notify the player when the opponent wants to voice chat.
This sample uses Game Center features that let players request friends and let the game access the player’s friends list.
When the player taps Add Friends in the Friends section of the content view, the
method presents a view controller that allows the player to send a friend request to another player.
When the player taps Access Friends, the
method checks the authorization status before accessing the player’s friends.
If the status is
or
, the method loads the friends and displays their names in a sheet.
The first time the sample loads the player’s friends, the system displays a dialog asking the player whether the sample may access their friends.
This dialog displays the value of the
information property list key as the reason for requesting access permission.
An error occurs if the sample calls
without permission or without providing a reason using the
key.
The
method also reports progress toward an achievement.
Each time the player starts a match, they earn 10% toward this achievement until they reach 100%.

code: // Set the progress for the achievement.
// Report the progress to Game Center.

inlineContent.text: For details about configuring achievements for a game, see
The
method saves the local player’s score to the leaderboard when either the player wins or the opponent forfeits.
For details about configuring leaderboards, see

The player can see their achievements and top scores using the access point that appears in the upper-left corner, or by tapping the buttons below Game Center Data in the content view. For example, when the player taps Top Scores, the
method shows the scores in the Game Center dashboard.
For more information about displaying Game Center information, see

inlineContent.text: and

abstract.text: A message that tells the user why the app needs access to their Game Center friends list.
A message that tells the user why the app is requesting access to the device’s microphone.
Handles the event when the local player accepts an invitation from another player.
Loads the local player’s friends list if the local player and their friends grant access.
A peer-to-peer network between a group of players that sign into Game Center.
Processes the data sent from another player to the local player.
Handles when players connect or disconnect from a match.
Initiates a request to find players for a peer-to-peer match.
An interface that allows a player to invite other players to a real-time game and automatch to fill any empty slots.
Handles when the view controller finds players for a peer-to-peer match.
A voice channel that allows players to speak with each other in a multiplayer game.
Provide your users a convenient connection to the Game Center dashboard.

doc://com.apple.documentation/documentat.title: Adding an access point to your game

abstract.text: Create a leaderboard for your game that ranks player scores based on a schedule.
Provide an interface for players to navigate to their Game Center data from your game.
Enable Game Center in your Xcode project and configure features in App Store Connect.
Create a more customized and optimized gaming experience by using matchmaking rules to find players in a real-time game.
Use achievements to motivate players and engage them more in your game.
Enable players to interact with friends, compare leaderboard ranks, earn achievements, and participate in multiplayer games.
An invitation to join a match sent to the local player from another player.
A protocol that handles invite events from Game Center.
A peer-to-peer network between a group of players that sign into Game Center.
An object that encapsulates the parameters to create a real-time or turn-based match.
An object that creates matches with other players without presenting an interface to the players.
An interface that allows a player to invite other players to a real-time game and automatch to fill any empty slots.
Enable players to voice chat with all, or groups of, players in a multiplayer game.

doc://com.apple.gamekit/documentation/Ga.title: Adding voice chat to multiplayer games

abstract.text: Send data between players in a real-time multiplayer game.

doc://com.apple.gamekit/documentation/Ga.title: Exchanging data between players in real-time games

abstract.text: Discover and invite other players to participate in a real-time game.

doc://com.apple.gamekit/documentation/Ga.title: Finding multiple players for a game

abstract.text: Game Center applies different type of rules you create in a particular order to find the best matches.
